title: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen Chop More Than $5M Off Boston-Area Home
text:
Superstars Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen have doubled down on efforts to sell their lavish refuge near Boston, chopping the price on Friday by more than $5 million, according to the listing.



The five-acre estate, hidden between a private liberal arts college and one of the oldest golf clubs in the country, is now asking $33.9 million, according to a spokeswoman for the listing agency, Gibson Sotheby’s International Realty. The home originally hit the market over the summer asking a hair under $40 million.



The renowned supermodel and her NFL quarterback husband tapped prolific celebrity architect Richard Landry to design the nearly 10,000-square-foot red-brick house in Brookline, Massachusetts.

Incorporating New England vernacular architecture, the house was completed in 2015 and boasts warm, modern interiors with rustic details like painted brick and exposed ceiling beams.



In total, the mansion includes five bedrooms, a wine room, a gym and a spa.



Outside, sprawling lawns encompass the family’s vegetable garden and a barn-style guest house—with nearly enough square footage to fill a tennis court—including a yoga room and sleeping loft.



The couple picked up the secluded slice of Boston real estate in 2013, when they bought a chunk of land from Pine Manor College for $4.5 million, according to county property records. Mr. Brady, 42, and Ms. Bündchen, 39, purchased the land through a limited liability company tied to Mr. Brady’s business manager.

When the home first listed in August, the New York Post reported that the power couple were looking to move closer to New York City as Mr. Brady prepares for his post-football career. This year, Mr. Brady signed a contract with the New England Patriots and said he plans to play until he’s 45.



Publicists for the couple could not immediately be reached for comment.
